editorialNotes.short: Learn to read and pronounce words with your new friend!
editorialNotes.tagline: Learn to read with a friend

name: Little Kitten My Pet Kitty Cat

editorialNotes.tagline: Holiday fun with a festive feline
editorialNotes.standard: The moment we met wee kitty Crumbs in Little Kitten, we let out an audible “awww.” This adorable digital feline encourages children to play and explore, interacting with the lively toys and simple games in Crumbs’ room. We’re amazed by the cinematic animation, and appreciate the sleep timer that sends Crumbs to bed when our kids’ screen time is over.
editorialNotes.short: Embark on exciting adventures with your own kitty pal.

editorialNotes.standard: The line never ends at Dr. Panda’s Ice Cream Truck, and that’s just how our kids like it. They jump at the chance to whip up new flavours and serve sky-high sundaes piled with toppings. Watching customers gobble down their desserts cracks them up every time (and us too).

Nothing beats a kid-friendly game that keeps the whole family captivated—and Toca has us snipping, straightening, and styling to our heart's content. Once we've perfected our customer's silly new ‘dos, we make sure to add some accessories, snap a pic, and share the hair.

editorialNotes.tagline: Try them, try them and you may!

editorialNotes.short: Blast off to outer space and travel to new planets.

name: Kids Vehicles: City Trucks & Buses for toddler boy

ios.subtitle: Make a routine & put on a show

editorialNotes.standard: Bursting with beats and energy, Toca Dance will make the whole family want to get up and groove. This incredibly cute game puts kids in charge of their own musical production—choosing dancers, costumes and techno tracks, and choreographing moves using simple swipes and taps. Once the performance starts, the real fun begins: you can fling items at the stage, set off pyrotechnics and other cool effects and even cheer (or boo) your squad. Seeing the payoff—an awesome video you can share—will encourage players to jump right back in and start working on their next great show.

Slide a shape into the correct hole—easy, right? It is, at first. But what makes Busy Shapes so clever is the way it gently gets more challenging, motivating little kids to find solutions to each puzzle through experimentation. From shape-changing to colour-mixing to hidden holes, we’re impressed with how the gameplay spurs out-of-the-box thinking, stimulating curious young minds.
